meanings.definition: To overlap or intertwine with each other.
meanings.sent1: The vines interlapping on the fence created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the trees interlapped in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The yarn balls interlapping in the basket looked like a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: Their interests interlapping like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The waves interlapping on the shore sounded like a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: To be connected or related in some way.
meanings.sent1: The characters' storylines interlapping in the novel added depth to the plot.
meanings.sent2: The history of the two countries interlapped through trade and diplomacy.
meanings.sent3: Their lives interlapping at the same event was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: The circles of influence interlapping in the business world created a complex network.
meanings.sent5: Their goals interlapping like a Venn diagram showed common interests.
